description: A simple homemade bread made from 4 ingredients that requires no kneading.
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 446°F (230°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 2. Whisk flour, salt, and baking soda together in a large mixing bowl. 3. Stir in buttermilk until a shaggy dough forms. 4. Flour your hands and work surface, then shape the dough into a ball. 5. Transfer to the baking sheet and score the top. 6. Bake for 10 minutes at 446°F, then reduce to 375°F (190°C) and bake for another 25-35 minutes until golden brown.
notes: For a whole wheat option, substitute white flour with whole wheat flour. Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 48 hours.
tags: Irish, bread, soda bread, quick bread
